ResourceHeader.ResourceName: The common time fitacf CDF data of SuperDARN Hokkaido West HF radar distributed by ERG-SC
ResourceHeader.Description: Common time fitacf data obtained by SuperDARN Hokkaido West HF radar. The data set consists primarily of the backscatter power, spectral width, and Doppler velocity derived with radar echoes in the field-of-view of the radar beams with time resolutions of 1-2 min. Data files are distributed in the Common Data Format (CDF) through the ERG-SC repository

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Data distributed with this CDF file can be used freely for scientific research. Please note that the data are not fully calibrated and may still contain glitches and errors which could yield scientifically wrong or misleading results. We strongly recommend working directly or checking with the PI (Nozomu Nishitani, ISEE, Nagoya Univ., E-mail: nisitani [at] isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) and/or researchers of the other SuperDARN PI groups regarding data accuracy and interpretation. Data users must contact the PI before any form of presentation/publication including any fraction or the entire part of data. Please acknowledge the research grant which enables the construction and operation of the SuperDARN Hokkaido West HF radar. An example of the acknowledgement statement is as follows: This research was partially supported by Special Funds for Education and Research (Energy Transport Processes in Geospace, Institute for Space-Earth Environmental Research (ISEE), Nagoya University) of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology of Japan.

NumericalData.Keyword: EARTH SCIENCE Sun-earth Interactions Ionosphere/Magnetosphere Dynamics Electric Fields/Electric Currents

Parameter.Name: Hardware station ID
Parameter.Description: The unique numeric ID of the radar

Parameter.Name: Hardware year
Parameter.Description: This and the next parameter describe the date up until which the radar configuration described in the hardware parameter

Parameter.Name: Hardware second of year
Parameter.Description: This and the previous parameter describe the date up until which the radar configuration described in the hardware parameter

Parameter.Name: Hardware Geog. Latitude
Parameter.Description: The geographic latitude of the radar location, given in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. Southern hemisphere values are negative

Parameter.Name: Hardware Geog. Longitude
Parameter.Description: The geographic longitude of the radar location, in degree given in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. West longitude values are negative

Parameter.Name: Hardware altitude
Parameter.Description: The altitude above sealevel of the radar location, in meter

Parameter.Name: Hardware Scanning Boresite
Parameter.Description: The direction of the center of the field-of-view of the radar, in degree, relative to geographic North, positive clockwise

Parameter.Name: Hardware beam separation
Parameter.Description: The angular separation of two adjacent beams, in degree. Normally 3.24 degrees

Parameter.Name: Hardware vdir
Parameter.Description: The sign of the velocity direction, either +1 or -1, usually +1.(At the radar level, backscattered signals with frequencies above the transmitted frequency are assigned positive Doppler velocities while backscattered signals with frequencies below the transmitted frequency are assigned negative Doppler velocity. This convention can be reversed by changes in receiver design or in the data samping rate. This parameter is set to +1 or -1 to maintain the convention.)

Parameter.Name: Hardware Attenuation Step
Parameter.Description: The step size of the receiver attenuation in dB

Parameter.Name: Hardware Time Difference
Parameter.Description: The relative time delay of signal paths from the interferometer array to the receiver and the main array to the receiver, in microseconds

Parameter.Name: Hardware phidiff
Parameter.Description: The sign of the phase shift between interferometer and main array, either +1 or -1, usually +1

Parameter.Name: Hardware Interferometer Array Position
Parameter.Description: The offset distance between the mid points of the interferometer and main array, (1st component) in the direction along the main array, positive towards higher antenna numbers, (2nd component) in the direction perpendicular to the main array, positive values indicate that the interferometer array is in front of the main array, (3rd component) in the vertical direction, positive up, in meter

Parameter.Name: Hardware Receiver Rise Time
Parameter.Description: The rise time of the analog receiver, in microseconds

Parameter.Name: rgate_no_0
Parameter.Description: The range gate number for each pixel observed sequantially by the radar for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: position_tbl_0
Parameter.Description: The table of geographical Latitudes and longitudes [deg] for the reflection points of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: Epoch_0
Parameter.Description: The start time of each beam observation sequence in the CDF epoch format for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: cpid_0
Parameter.Description: ID of observation mode for 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: channel_0
Parameter.Description: ID of the channel used for the observation for the 75 range gate measurement. This value should be either of 0 (non-stereo radar) or 1 (channelA of a stereo radar)

Parameter.Name: int_time_0
Parameter.Description: Integration time over which received pulses are integrated to derive the fitting parameters for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: azim_no_0
Parameter.Description: Number of the azimuthal direction of radar beam for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: pwr_0
Parameter.Description: Backscatter power of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: pwr_err_0
Parameter.Description: Error of Backscatter power of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: spec_width_0
Parameter.Description: Spectral widths of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: spec_width_err_0
Parameter.Description: Error of spectral widths of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: vlos_0
Parameter.Description: Doppler velocity of radar echoes for the 75 range mode measurement. This Doppler velocity corresponds to the bulk velocity of ionospheric electrons perpendicular to the ambient magnetic field

Parameter.Name: vlos_err_0
Parameter.Description: Error of Doppler velocity of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: elev_angle_0
Parameter.Description: Elevation angle of returning HF waves observed by a set of the main antennas and the interferometers for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: elev_angle_err_0
Parameter.Description: Error of elevation angle for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: phi_0
Parameter.Description: Phase offset derived by calculating the auto correlation function (ACF) for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: phi_err_0
Parameter.Description: Error of phase offset for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: echo_flag_0
Parameter.Description: Echo flag (ionospheric/ground) of radar echoes for 75 range gate measurement. 1: ionospheric echo, 0: ground scatter, based on the empirical criteria by Millan et al.

Parameter.Name: quality_0
Parameter.Description: Data quality flag of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement. This value is how many criteria (described in "quality_flag_?" in detail) are satisfied. 0 means that no condition for bad/poor data is satisfied, that is, the data is in good shape. The data quality becomes worse as quality_? increases

Parameter.Name: quality_flag_0
Parameter.Description: Breakdown of judgements for criteria in evaluating the data quality flag of radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement. Each bit status of this value (1 byte integer) show if each criterion is satisfied. LSB: backscatter power is less 3dB, 2nd bit: currently unused, 3rd bit: spectral width is greater than 1000 m/s, 4th bit (MSB): currently unused

Parameter.Name: scanno_0
Parameter.Description: Serial number (in a CDF file) referring to each 2D scan. (Nominally 16) beams with the same scanno_? form a full field-of-view scan.

Parameter.Name: scanstartflag_0
Parameter.Description: If this value is 1, then the current beam is the start of a new 2D scan

Parameter.Name: lagfr_0
Parameter.Description: The lag time in microsecond for the first range gate for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: smsep_0
Parameter.Description: The sampling separation in microsecond between neighboring range gates

Parameter.Name: nrang_max_0
Parameter.Description: Maximum range gate number for the 75 range gate measurement. This should be 75

Parameter.Name: tfreq_0
Parameter.Description: Frequency in kHz of transmitted HF waves for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: noise_0
Parameter.Description: Noise level (in dB) in receiving radar echoes for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: num_ave_0
Parameter.Description: This value shows how many pulse sequences are integrated to evaluate ACFs for a beam

Parameter.Name: txpl_0
Parameter.Description: Time width in microsecond of the entire pulse sequences for each range gate for the 75 range gate measurement

Parameter.Name: rgate_no_1
Parameter.Description: The range gate number for each pixel observed sequantially by the radar for the 110 range gate measurement
